q: `` When somebody gets 49 points in the first three quarters obviously its going to draw attention to the other team,'' said Allen Iverson , whose career high of 60 came against Orlando on Feb. 12, 2005. When somebody's got 49 points they want to make sure I get the ball out of my hands, and that's what they did. My responsibly is to give it up and my teammates had to make plays. They couldn't. Paul Pierce was 4-for-10 from the field in the fourth and the rest of the team made 3 of 9. While Allen Iverson got cold, Kobe Bryant heated up. Kobe Bryant picked up his fourth foul 38

The far less dramatic truth is that we were wrong, Donald Rumsfeld writes. The Donald Rumsfelds now spend much of their time on their ranch near Taos, New Mexico. Eric Schmidt said that although what he called the`` triumvirate approach'' of leadership by himself, Larry Page and Sergey Brin has real benefits, it is time to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability. Eric Schmidt became CEO of Google in July 2001, when he'd already been chairman of the board for several months- Google put him on the board and made him chairman in March of that year.

The word is that the American executives behind the launch of Simon Cowell 's X Factor US are not convinced that Cole is well enough known among the show's potential core audience. It was thought the American job was a done deal but it seems the US executives have had a last-minute change of heart. They are now questioning whether she's famous enough in America. He said he wants to remain in private life although he is happy to be an informal presidential adviser. The administration knows that I am quite content with the work I am doing now, he said.`` I am not interested in a government job.''
